answers.answer: Good for you!  Glad to see everything is going well and on track.  It's a lot of us June mommies lingering around.  I think Sept & Oct were some busy months around the world!!

Very happy to hear things are going well for you. I hope it stays that way for you. THings are good here too. Still have quite a ways to go,but I get to look forward to the Rhogam shot as well sometime down the road. Yayyy for us!!! I have clear til September to wait to meet our little angel, but we get to try to find out what we are having on May 8th. I cant wait!!!

i have really been out of touch on here lately...  i don't get to get to the computer as much as i did before!!!1 question...  what is rhogam for?skylynns_mom, i am so glad to hear your apointment went well.  i have one tomorrow (and the glucose test).  at my last u/s our boy was also in a breech position so maybe the doctor can tell me if he's moved now, too.i've been doing good here except for my stress level (working on it!!!).  and i had to go to l&d on tuesday for fluids b/c i was dehydrated from the virus i caught that ended up being pretty nasty!  but other than minor discomforts in my back and being tired i can't complain!!!  :)i wish dh and i had already been able to choose a name like you...  this is going to continue to be a long process!  he's out of town right now and i just emailed him a few more suggestions to get his input so we'll see what he says.  i'm afraid to ask for any advice on here b/c i don't like to get too much input from people other than dh b/c it makes me overthink the names!i hope you start feeling better w/ your swelling and being so tired...  hopefully the iron will help!  and glad to hear your update!!!
i am glad everything is going well for you lets just hope the swelling goes down

rhogram is for people who have certain blood types.  i am A- so everytime i get prego at about 28 weeks i have to have the shot right in my BUT T (literally) LOL  I'm glad to hear that everyone else seems to be doing well too.KennedyIt took us a long time to agree on names, we were thinking of names long before i got prego and didn't decided until a few weeks ago.  We coudn't agree on anything! But once i suggested Isaiah, he loved it and thats what we stuck with.  As for the baby turning i swear that i felt him turn he was going crazy for a really long time, moving much more then usual and all over the place, i could still feel him going at it while i was walking, standing, and sitting.......maybe your little man will turn too, i hope so, i was so worried that i would have to let my doctor turn him......i REALLY didn't want that to happen.  Good luck at your appointment and let us know how it went.HopefulDamn that rhogam shot LOL!  Are you hoping for a boy or a girl?  May isn't to far off, i know b/c i am getting married that month and it seems to be sneaking up VERY quick..

Kennedy- The rhogam is a shot us pregnatn ladies get if our blood type is negative. It keeps our antibodies from fighting the babies antibodies if their blood type turns out to be positive.Sky-- Tell me about it. ITs been a while since I had it, but doesnt that one hurt like a penicillin shot? No biggy. We are hoping for a boy since we have the two girls already, but as long as the bay is healthy I dont care either way. What are you hoping for? Yes, I am excited for May. I think it will be here before we know it. COngrats to you. What day in May are you getting married?

I can't remember if the shot hurts or not.  We are having a little boy, his name is Isaiah.  i have a daughter already so we were glad that we could have a boy to incase we don't have anymore kids.  Although i would like to have 1-2 more after this one.  Although if the prices of things keep rising I think we may have to stop at 2.  Daycare is extremely expensive as well. We are getting married May 17th........seems to be sneaking up soquickly.

i am A Negative and over here in england we have to have a anti d injection i had one at 13wks and i have got to have them at 28 and 34wks (i am sooo looking foreward to the next ones   NOT) They hurt like hell my arm goes dead for a few days  (3more wks and counting untill i have my next one)
Thats strange, i am A- too and i have never heard of that.  maybe its another form of the Rhogam shot?  I do know that i am glad i only have to get the shot once LOL

it probably is another form of the Rhogam shot(ive never heard of it ) if it is why dont they just keep it simple and have the same name? I have to go for my anti d 2wk on thursday (im dreading it ) i also have a fear of neadles, ive also got to go for a gtt the wednesday before at the hospital (what fun im going to have that week )even more needles!!!!

LOL i am right there with ya.  i go for my rhogam shot on the 3rd which is only 2 weeks away and right before that i have to go for my glucose test and some more blood work.  i not much a fan of needles either

i have a question...you said that your baby had turned on his own...  before he turned were you feeling pretty much all movements really low?  and now that he has turned, do you feel a difference in where his movements are?i don't know if you saw my update from my appt, but i forgot to ask the doc if he could tell me if my baby has turned or not.  i feel pretty much all movements (which is still not a whole lot) down really low and was wondering if that meant that he was still in the breech position.just wondering...........

For awhile most of the movements were really low but the last week that he was still breech i felt it everywhere.  He was laying horizontally across me though, so that may have had something to do with it.  I do know that i had an appointment on a friday and he was still breech, i had another appointment that following wednesday and he wasn't anymore.  I am almost positive that he turned wednesday morning because i could "feel" it sorta.  he was active for a lot longer then usual, and he is Very active, so matter which way i sat or moved or walked he was still going nuts in there.  It felt like he was doing sumsalts or something.  I hope that helps a little, its kinda hard to explain how if felt.  Good luck i hope your little man turns for you.

thanks!  i don't know if it matters to the docs if he's breech or not since i'm having another c/s but i just like to know things, ya know?!?!  i just don't like the fact that i don't feel enough movement (in my opinion) anyways...  so when i get to feel it and its really low still then i guess its his little feet still down there...  i guess i'll just wait and see what happens!  thank you  :)
No problem.  i'm not sure if it matters if your having a c-section....i would think that it should but ya never know....good luck.

question: I am now 25 weeks 1 day along and just got back from my check up.  Everything looks good.  i just found out that i am anemic so my doctor started me on some iron supplements.  The baby finally turned! He is no longer breech and is in the head down position ready to go, hopefully he stays that way LOL.  I have an appointment is 3 weeks, before i go i have to get my glucose test done and some more blood work.  At that appointment i will be 28 weeks so i have to have my rhogram shot, YAY for me (NOT) LOL.  then i start going every 2 weeks, i can't believe that i am so close to the 3rd trimester already....it went so quickly and i cant wait to meet Isaiah.  i have been so exhausted lately, and my whole body hurts, hopefully the iron with help with some of the exhaustion.....Oh yea nad my blood pressure and urine are fines, so i am keeping the preeclampsia at bay still, thank good.  My swelling is still pretty bad but i can deal with it as long as the baby and i are safe.How is everyone else doing?
title: Update on me
